unittitle.value: Dorothy O. Helly Research Files for <emph render="italic">Livingstone's Legacy: Horace Waller and Victorian Mythmaking</emph>

p.value: Identification of item, date; Dorothy O. Helly Research Files for <emph render="italic">Livingstone's Legacy: Horace Waller and Victorian Mythmaking</emph>; TAM 161; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Donated by Dorothy O. Helly in 2004. The accession number associated with this gift is 2004.022.

Dorothy O. Helly (1931-) is a distinguished historian and (as of 2010) is Professor of History and Women's Studies at Hunter College and The Graduate School at the City University of New York (CUNY).  She also has been involved with various academic women's organizations, such as Women Writing Women's Lives.  Helly's best known work is <emph render="italic">Livingstone's Legacy: Horace Waller and Victorian Mythmaking</emph> (1987), which analyzes Horace Waller's editing of Livingstone's journals.

This collection consists of photocopied documents and notes that Helly accumulated during her research for <emph render="italic">Livingstone's Legacy</emph>.  Most of the documents are from archives in the United Kingdom, as well as some from archives in Southern Africa.  The collection also contains copies of related scholarly works.
